title: Franklin Gothic Light Condensed
content: This might be a silly question but does anyone know if Franklin Gothic as a light condensed version? Thanks in advance for your help.
author: bethany

comments.content:
It has a [Book Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115073900/http:/www.linotype.com/13775/itcfranklingothicbookcondensed-font.html) weight. Maybe that is light enough for you? Are you looking for a lighter weight to pair with that?

Here is a link to the whole ITC Franklin Gothic family, which has 20 parts: [http://www.linotype.com/655/itcfranklingothic-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115073900/http:/www.linotype.com/655/itcfranklingothic-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/655/itcfranklingothic-family.html")

Quite similar to that is [Lightline Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115073900/http:/www.linotype.com/89881/lightlinegothic-family.html), also originally by [Morris Fuller Benton](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115073900/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Morris%20Fuller%20Benton). It looks both Light and Condensed to me. Maybe it'd hit the spot?

There is also FontBureau's [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115073900/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonSans/styles), also based on Benton's work, with many weights and degress of compression.
thank you both for all of your help!
